definition: thin or slender/finely particulate/thin and soft/fine/delicate/trifling/(of a sound) quiet/frugal
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

sentences.english: I then did something I like to do every now and then, which is count my blessings.
sentences.chinese: 然后我做了一件我一直喜欢的事儿，细数幸福。

sentences.english: Red tongue less moss, pulse count.
November is for thanksgiving, count God's bounteous graces.
sentences.chinese: 十一月是感恩的季节，细数神所赐的丰盛恩典。

sentences.english: That summer day, I don't know what I did?
sentences.chinese: 细数一夏的日子，我不知道我做了些什么？

sentences.english: Leave some good memories to, when you are old, count used.
sentences.chinese: 留一些美好给回忆，当年华老去，细数曾经时。

sentences.english: Count to accompany you through the maintenance, deduce belong to us forever.
sentences.chinese: 细数陪你走过的细水长流，演绎属于我们的天长地久。

sentences.english: Don't believe, you count nearby those people to speak few preach.
sentences.chinese: 不信，你细数身边那些说过话的人没有几个言行一致。

sentences.english: Jarlaxle's hand flicked several times, too quickly for Dinin to count.
sentences.chinese: 贾拉索的手快速移动了几次，快得狄宁无法细数。

sentences.english: Read it silently count melancholy, go into hurt.
sentences.chinese: 吟念清词细数惆怅，默然离去成伤。

sentences.english: If I held in my hand , every grain of sand , since time first began to be.
sentences.chinese: 即使自最初一刻便握紧手心的砂，细数每一粒记忆。

definition: to make an inventory/to take stock
to turn around/to look back/to recollect
to learn sth over again/to review/to brush up/to revive (memories, friendship etc)
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
to recount/to tell of/to relate/(fig.) (of a thing) to stand as testament to (some past history)
